message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressant that is used to prevent organ rejection. Common side effects include hyperlipidemia and thrombocytopenia. Pancreatitis is not a known side effect of sirolimus. Cytokine release syndrome and hypersensitivity reactions are more commonly associated with immune checkpoint inhibitors, while nephrotoxicity and gingival hyperplasia are more commonly associated with other immunosuppressive drugs such as cyclosporine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressive drug used to prevent organ rejection. Hyperlipidemia and thrombocytopenia are among the most common side effects of this medication. Pancreatitis and cytokine release syndrome/hypersensitivity reaction are more often associated with other immunosuppressants, while nephrotoxicity and gingival hyperplasia are side effects of other medications used to prevent organ rejection such as cyclosporine and tacrolimus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressant medication used to prevent rejection after organ transplantation. It often causes hyperlipidemia and thrombocytopenia as side effects. Other options are not commonly associated with sirolimus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressant used to prevent organ rejection. Its side effects include hyperlipidemia and thrombocytopenia. None of the other options are listed as potential side effects of sirolimus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressant drug used after organ transplantation. The side effects include hyperlipidemia and thrombocytopenia, which are both associated with increased risk of cardiovascular disease. Pancreatitis is a side effect of azathioprine, cytokine release syndrome and hypersensitivity reaction are side effects of anti-CD3 monoclonal antibody, and nephrotoxicity and gingival hyperplasia are side effects of cyclosporine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressant drug used to prevent organ transplant rejection. The potential side effects could include hyperlipidemia and thrombocytopenia. Pancreatitis is a possible side effect of other immunosuppressant drugs such as tacrolimus. Cytokine release syndrome and hypersensitivity reactions are potential side effects of chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy. Nephrotoxicity and gingival hyperplasia are side effects of cyclosporine, another immunosuppressant drug.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressive medication used to prevent transplant rejection. Side effects include hyperlipidemia, thrombocytopenia, and anemia. Pancreatitis is a rare side effect. Cytokine release syndrome and hypersensitivity reactions are associated with other types of immunosuppressive medications. Nephrotoxicity and gingival hyperplasia are side effects of other immunosuppressive medications, such as cyclosporin A.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressant medication used to prevent organ rejection. It commonly causes hyperlipidemia and thrombocytopenia as side effects. Pancreatitis is a possible side effect of other immunosuppressant medications. Cytokine release syndrome and hypersensitivity reactions are rare side effects. Nephrotoxicity and gingival hyperplasia are not common side effects of sirolimus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressant drug used to prevent transplant rejection. Hyperlipidemia and thrombocytopenia are common side effects of sirolimus. Pancreatitis is a rare side effect. Cytokine release syndrome and hypersensitivity reactions are associated with chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy. Nephrotoxicity and gingival hyperplasia are associated with other immunosuppressant drugs like cyclosporine and tacrolimus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sirolimus is an immunosuppressive medication used to prevent organ rejection. Hyperlipidemia and thrombocytopenia are common side effects of this medication. Pancreatitis is a potential side effect of another immunosuppressive medication, azathioprine. Cytokine release syndrome and hypersensitivity reaction are potential side effects of chimeric antigen receptor T-cell therapy. Nephrotoxicity and gingival hyperplasia are potential side effects of cyclosporine, another immunosuppressive medication.
